issue.title: [fund.ts.v2] No handling for over-aligned types in optional

discussion.p: does not specify whether over-aligned types are supported. In other places where we specify allocation of user-supplied types, we state that "It is implementation-defined whether over-aligned types are supported (3.11)." (Examples: /p1, /p5, /p1). We should presumably do the same thing here.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4562.

blockquote.p: […] The contained value shall be allocated in a region of the optional<T> storage suitably aligned for the type T. It is implementation-defined whether over-aligned types are supported (C++14 §3.11). When an object of type optional<T> is contextually converted to bool, the conversion returns true if the object contains a value; otherwise the conversion returns false.
